description: The AMP Developer Relations team's mission is to give publishers the tools and guidance they need to build excellent content experiences on the web. We are the bridge between the the inside of Google and outside developer communities and help developers succeed with AMP. As a small but mighty team, we run all developer documentation, events, social channels, and outreach related projects.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Experience writing blog posts and maintaining social media channels.
  • Experience speaking at conferences.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Understanding of AMP's fundamentals and syntax.
  • Excellent CSS and HTML skills.
responsibilities:
• Speak at and organize conferences about AMP and the web.
  • Create guides, tutorials, demos, and examples to scale AMP's outreach and educate developers.
  • Bring back product feedback to the core development teams and improve AMP.
  • Create videos for the AMP channel and manage social strategy.
  • Collect intelligence/data about AMP adoption and developer satisfaction.
title: Developer Advocate, AMP, Developer Relations
